articles.headline: Loretta Lynch, Former Attorney General, Is Joining a Top Law Firm Back in New York
articles.snippet: Paul Weiss has hired Ms. Lynch as a litigation partner, at a time when big law firms are under fire for not doing more to promote women and minorities.
articles.abstract: Paul Weiss has hired Ms. Lynch as a litigation partner, at a time when big law firms are under fire for not doing more to promote women and minorities.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the two years since leaving her post as the world’s most powerful prosecutor, Loretta Lynch has kept a low profile. She cared for her elderly parents. She gave the occasional commencement speech. She refrained from loudly criticizing her successors in the Trump administration.

articles.headline: Trump Undercuts Bolton on North Korea and Iran
articles.snippet: The disconnect between President Trump and his third national security adviser has sown confusion around the world about America’s foreign policy.
articles.abstract: The disconnect between President Trump and his third national security adviser has sown confusion around the world about America’s foreign policy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump was grousing about John R. Bolton, his national security adviser, at his Florida club not long ago. Guests heard the president complaining about the advice he was getting and wondering if Mr. Bolton was taking him down a path he did not want to go.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: The Trade War’s Next Battle Could Be China’s Access to Wall Street
articles.snippet: As some inside and outside the White House call for weakening China’s links to U.S. financial markets, e-commerce giant Alibaba is considering listing its shares in Hong Kong.
articles.abstract: As some inside and outside the White House call for weakening China’s links to U.S. financial markets, e-commerce giant Alibaba is considering listing its shares in Hong Kong.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — President Trump’s trade war with China has prompted a broad rethinking of how the two economies have become so intertwined, leading some manufacturers to trim supply chains in China and American authorities to start cutting off crucial technology for Chinese companies.
articles.byline: By Keith Bradsher and Ana Swanson

articles.headline: Sure, the Populists Gained, but the Real Winners May Be for Europe
articles.snippet: In a fragmented new European Parliament, President Emmanuel Macron of France’s pro-Europe forces and the Greens may have more leverage to influence both policy and personnel.
articles.abstract: In a fragmented new European Parliament, President Emmanuel Macron of France’s pro-Europe forces and the Greens may have more leverage to influence both policy and personnel.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — The results this week of the European Parliament elections were a humiliating blow at home to President Emmanuel Macron of France, as his party finished second to the far-right nationalist Marine Le Pen.

articles.headline: A Fiat Chrysler-Renault Merger Would Put Nissan in a Bind
articles.snippet: Nissan’s clout could be diminished by a merger between its longtime partner Renault and Fiat Chrysler. How it responds could help reshape the global auto industry.
articles.abstract: Nissan’s clout could be diminished by a merger between its longtime partner Renault and Fiat Chrysler. How it responds could help reshape the global auto industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Japanese police officers surrounded Carlos Ghosn’s Gulfstream jet last November and packed him off to a Tokyo jail, they unwittingly provoked a seismic realignment of the global auto industry.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing, Liz Alderman and Ben Dooley

articles.headline: ‘Blocked Off From Civilization’: Floodwaters Turn Oklahoma Town Into an Island
articles.snippet: Braggs, a town of 259 in rural Oklahoma, has become a virtual island. Floodwaters have nearly surrounded it, cutting off residents, who have formed an ad hoc emergency response network.
articles.abstract: Braggs, a town of 259 in rural Oklahoma, has become a virtual island. Floodwaters have nearly surrounded it, cutting off residents, who have formed an ad hoc emergency response network.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRAGGS, Okla. — Flooding has turned a rural town in eastern Oklahoma into an island — cut off on nearly all sides by water.

articles.headline: Huawei Revs Up Its U.S. Lawsuit, With the Media in Mind
articles.snippet: The Chinese telecommunications giant has filed for summary judgment against the White House as it challenges limits against it via the courts and public opinion.
articles.abstract: The Chinese telecommunications giant has filed for summary judgment against the White House as it challenges limits against it via the courts and public opinion.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Huawei is ramping up its legal challenge to American limits on purchases of its equipment, in a sign that it is doubling down on its strategy of fighting the Trump administration through the courts and public opinion rather than through quiet negotiations.

articles.headline: Which Box Do You Check? Some States Are Offering a Nonbinary Option
articles.snippet: As nonbinary teenagers push for driver’s licenses that reflect their identity, a fraught debate over the nature of gender has arrived in the nation’s statehouses.
articles.abstract: As nonbinary teenagers push for driver’s licenses that reflect their identity, a fraught debate over the nature of gender has arrived in the nation’s statehouses.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — Ever since El Martinez started asking to be called by the gender-neutral pronouns “they/them” in the ninth grade, they have fielded skepticism in a variety of forms and from a multitude of sources about what it means to identify as nonbinary.

articles.headline: Mueller, in First Comments on Russia Inquiry, Declines to Clear Trump
articles.snippet: Though he did not rule out congressional testimony, the special counsel also said that he would only testify about the facts already in the report.
articles.abstract: Though he did not rule out congressional testimony, the special counsel also said that he would only testify about the facts already in the report.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel, declined on Wednesday to clear President Trump of obstruction of justice in his first public characterization of his two-year investigation of Russia’s interference in the 2016 presidential election.

articles.headline: After Coalition Talks Crumble, Israel on Course for Another Election
articles.snippet: Benjamin Netanyahu seemed to have an easy path back to power. But his efforts ran aground on a power struggle among his potential partners.
articles.abstract: Benjamin Netanyahu seemed to have an easy path back to power. But his efforts ran aground on a power struggle among his potential partners.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu suffered a stunning defeat on Thursday after he failed to meet a midnight deadline to form a new government, casting a cloud over his future as prime minister and thrusting Israel into the chaos of a new election.
